The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: I am not sure where to begin with this title\, but I will say this: TLOU was an amazing\, heart-felt\, beautifully crafted and written game. Seven years later\, this pile gets dumped on us. In an effort to be as fair as I can\, the visuals\, animations\, voice acting\, and world are amazingly well done. But...that's not why I wanted to play this game. The gameplay is stale - it does little to iterate or improve on a legacy system (PS3) on the next-generation console (PS4).The main characters that I loved so much didn't even seem the same. Joel doesn't act like Joel\, Ellie doesn't act like Ellie\, and ham-handed new characters that also don't make much sense. The story is shoved down your throat\, there is no choice involved\, and - lest we call forget - revenge is bad. Unless you're a character named Abby who has cake and eats it too.Oh\, and you play multiple hours as a ho-hum character that I just couldn't bring myself to give a crap about. The depth of character from the first game is starkly missing.Not worth the buy. 3/10 because its sound\, acting\, and visuals were amazing. Aside from that? Eh\, if you're curious\, watch a VOD of gameplay on YT or your favorite streaming platform.… Expand
